<userid>116105546474763387455<//userid><user_name>Eurshla Osby< /user_name>< time>
1539803774161< /time>
<Rate>5<//Rate>< Review>
What little find.... a small hole in the wall, I may have never walked in if a friend had not told me, I've been a few times now, and have not been disappointed. Everything is made fresh, I had Basa, prawn and fries , fresh nicely fried,  not greasy, the breading on the prawn is a thick  crunchy crust, well seasoned.. I've also had the teriyaki prawn w/rice and salad, typical iceberg lettuce salad,  but it was really fresh and crunchy, just tasty,  the teriyaki prawns were delish.... cant wait to go back and try something else... YUM!!< /Review>

<Text>I have been to the hotel on several occasions.  The front desk staff is exceptional.  I do not understand how anyone can rate them rude.  Everyone you meet has a smile upon their face from the front desk to the house keepers to the grounds keepers.  I have over heard if a guest had a complaint while waiting, they quickly addressed the problem to the appropriate solution staff immediately to ensure a guest satisfaction at least to my satisfaction that I would expect an immediate response. The private conference rooms are clean and set appropriate to any business meeting needs.  The outside lake setting with the water spouts is comforting to sit by and relax for meditation or a moment just to breath. The pool is crisp and clean. They have a nice little shop, and coffee shop.   The hotel is beautiful,  They have a very romantic, comfortable setting night club and lounge.  The food is beyond exceptional.  I feel they go beyond the call of duty to make your stay enjoyable.  If you smell chemicals know you have a clean room!  Some people have allergies like myself and appreciate no sprays to cover up as it saves on my senses.  I rather know a room is clean.</Text></record>

<user_id>107218783997724590231</user_id>< name>
TJ Taylor< /name>
< time>
1468907968661</time>
<rating>4<//rating><Text>This is a wonderful hotel with a beautiful view of a lake.  The staff is very friendly and the cleaning of the rooms are daily.  The rooms are spacious and business grade.  You have free wi-fi, ice, central heating/air, clean linen, adjustable beds (sleep number), coffee maker, alarm clock radio, hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap.  The view of the lake was grand with a fountain, geese on the water, a Koi fish pond with it's own fountain and a nice pathway.  The hotel also has a swimming pool with a safety fence a small amphitheater area with soft music coming through speakers when not in use. There are ice rooms located around the property with soda machines.

The convention rooms are elegant and host many events. There is a Grill that serves and offers room service, a Bar but my favorite is the dining room.  The breakfasts were fresh cooked daily whether it was served or buffet and refilled often.  The morning servers along with the chef and cooks were very friendly and personable. They were my favorite part of the experience not excluding Sylvia at the front desk.

The rooms are very clean along with their bathrooms. Because of the fear of bed bugs in some of the local motels and extended stay hotels this was a pleasant experience. alleviating those concerns. All concerns are addressed immediately (not that there should be any but things can happen).

Do be aware that during the wet season it tended to flood in front of the entrance to the hotel's property. (This might have been addressed by now)

This hotel is a definite Yes and a Must Try.</Text><Pictures>None<//Pictures><response>None< /response>< gmapID>
0x809ad7525386930f:0x1ce2d320129712b8< /gmapID>

<Time>1456296177000< /Time>< Review>
The hotel is somewhat dated but has a lot charm. Most of the rooms are facing a large lake with a large water fountain in the middle. Rooms are reasonably large with sleep number beds and the standard ameneties. Good front desk and huskeeping staff. They need to infuse some cash to upgrade it to competative hotels in the area. The hotel is in a strange area but it very close to to downtown, Arden Fair, business 80 freeway and lots of restaurants and shopping. The hotel is a good value, but needs some work.< /Review>

< Review>
Ok first I don't know where some of these nut jobs were staying, but I have been at this motel for 4 days for work. I am from San Francisco. I have been in construction for most of my life and even a building inspector at one time in the city of San Francisco. I have not seen any evidence that this is anything but a lovely place to stay. There are hundreds of units on the property, so maybe it could be true that there are a few bad ones as the odds are in favor of that. However my co worker who is staying at the Marriott nearby says she wants to stay here  instead. In fact we do work in many high end Hotels for a living. And from what I ave seen, this place is a 3-4 star depending on your taste.< /Review>

<response>None</response>< Text>
This place is terrible. My husband and I were paying for my sister-in-law and her daughter to stay there after their house caught fire. We got our original deal through Hotwire for $68/night. Once that reservation was up, we weren't able to extend at that rate and from there, everything went horribly down hill. They changed the rate every night, ranging from $120 to $165, always with a different excuse. Their website said $79/night weekdays and $109/night on weekends. They explained with different reasons each time why we could not get those rates. The staff was the rudest bunch I have ever encountered and the manager was even worse as we over heard her telling the trainee she was working with "And that's how you do it" after charging us the highest amount they had so far. The morals that staff has is shameful and the Red Lion should be ashamed of this location to the fullest, taking advantage of people the way they are and finding it humorous. Shame on them. We moved our family members to the Best Western HOTEL (not a MOTEL like the Red Lion) in a much nicer neighborhood, much better reviews and a much nicer establishment for $110/night. I'm not sure why we didn't go there first since we travel often and usually stay at one of their establishments, it is the LAST time I will ever go there, I wouldn't stay there if they gave me an entire month free and that is the absolute truth. < text>
This painting service is great!  We had an interior room with high(18 foot) ceilings, that had water damage and cracks in the Sheetrock.  The drywall was repaired, textured an all walls were painted.  The project manager, Brandon, was very helpful with color selection, and painted several areas for our approval. The crew showed up on time, left the work area neat and cleaned up very well. If you have a painting project in mind, either interior or exterior, give Green Valley a call for an estimate from Them.  They are truly a high quality contractor!</text>

<user>103751073515869912115</user><user_name>John Taliaferro< /user_name><Date>1601422602721< /Date><Rating>5</Rating>< Text>
We own a wooden house built in 1936. We bought it about 5 years ago and the place looked good. We found, however, that within 5 years, the paint began to peel, bubble and crack. When a strip about 5 feet long began to curl off we started making calls.  We found Green Valley Painting by talking with a neighbor: we made a call and asked them to come out to give us an estimate. They responded the same day and made the appointment. They were the only one of a group of guys we called to respond quickly and come when they said they would. Ian looked over the house, and came back with a quote within a day. I was impressed with his knowledge, his openness to listening to what we wanted and his understanding of what needed to be done. He said we would be in the pipe line and he would set up time for the painting of the house. They were able to bump our house up in the schedule.
Their work was always timely, of excellent quality and they did what they said they would do within the time that they said they would do it. No hold ups, no delays. The crew was friendly, capable and busy. They arrived early and were on the job working hard.  I trust their work, and their ability to do what was asked for them to do with no shortcuts or changes. They power washed the house, scraped, sanded, caulked, primed, and painted with two coats. They masked everything, took care of our stuff as they worked around the house and left zero mess,  I honestly had no worries and I was completely satisfied with the work that was done. You cannot beat that, in my mind, it's what you hope for in a business and service contract. Ian and his men were awesome. Here are three photos from the work, the original green color and the new blue. People have stopped and commented positively on the work. Thank you GVP.<//Text>

< Review>
Green Valley painting is phenomenal. Can't say enough about this company. We did an interior house remodel, and Ian and his team stood above the rest. <rate>5<//rate><text>It's not very often that I give a review but I feel this company has earned one. I obtained several estimates to paint my house and chose Green Valley Painting. The attention to detail impressed me. My house is not an easy one to paint and it took some expertise. The crew of painters were professional, energetic, and on a mission. You could tell this is a result of an organized and well run company. I would like to thank Ian and all of Green Valley Painting for a job well done.
Not all homes are alike and so not all prices are alike. As a licensed contractor and real estate agent I call it as I see it. Some of the companies that I contacted did not have workman's comp or liability insurance. This is so important especially when the painters need to climb on your roof to paint your chimneys and other hard to access areas. Green Valley Painting includes their insurance certificates with their proposal. I have painted myself and have hired many painting contractors over the years but it's obvious that Green Valley Painting stands out. Once again-Thank You.

<rate>5</rate>< review>
We have two 2-story buildings at our residence.  We had GV paint the interior & exterior several years ago & it still looks fabulous.  Ian, the owner, had great recommendations for paint color and type.  His crew washed it, caulked it, primed & otherwise prepped it before, which is why it still looks great.  Recently we had them paint the interior of our carriage house.  Same story - excellent service, excellent prep, beautiful paint job, and cleaned up after.  BTW, their texture repair guy does a fabulous job.  We expect to have  them come to repair our earthquake cracks, too.  You can count on Green Valley to do an outstanding job.</review>

<text>In april we started a first floor remodel, and kitchen cabinets were the last step in our project. Replacing and refacing were out of the budget, so we opted for painting. I was nervous that painting wouldn't look as beautiful or professional as "new" but I could not have been more wrong!

Enter Green Valley Painting. From the front desk staff to the paint crew, they were courteous, clean, efficient and the finished product was more than we could have hoped for. They arrived on time daily and left our home clean when they departed. The owner Ian, was patient with me while I picked color and the hardware, which they installed for us. With a young son at home we were grateful for their adherence to the project schedule and the job was completed on time as promised.

If you have a painting project that you want done quickly with excellent results, I promise you will not be disappointed by Ian and the team at Green Valley Painting!</text>< GmapID>

< Text>
My experience with Green Valley was exceptional, truly.  I don't write a lot of reviews and have no stake in this other to thank Ian and his crew' for their work. I'm a real estate professional and investor and have ordered countless painting jobs over the years. I even worked my way through college painting and ran many of my own jobs in my early career and the point I am trying to make is, I know good from bad and exceptional from very good.  These guys are very talented, professional, courteous and actually fun to be around. Naturally I got several bids and theirs was very fair.  I have learned that fa air bid usual trumps a low and a high bid rarely equated to better quality - more generally to a company that may be understaffed and can throw a number at the job and hope for the best.  So thank you Ina and Green Valley and I hope you are willing to work with me again.< /Text>

< text>
We chose Green Valley Painting based off reviews only, and it was one of the best decision we've made for our new home. They are phenomenal to work with. Three major things stood out to me while working with them:

1. I specifically wanted Benjamin Moore White Dove for my walls, but when I tested out Kelly Moore's match of White Dove (this is the paint company they prefer to use), I felt like the color was not the same. When I asked Casey, the project manager, about it, he assured me that he would make sure that Kelly Moore matched the paint correctly to the Benjamin Moore sample I wanted, and he did. That may not seem like a big deal, but when you are paying thousands of dollars to paint the entire interior of your house, and you want a specific color, it matters that it's done correctly and Casey made sure that it was. He also was extremely helpful in guiding decisions regarding trim/ceiling color since he used to work for Kelly Moore and has a lot of expertise.

2. We had a miscommunication on the length of time the project would take, and had movers scheduled to come while the work was still being done. Casey and the rest of the crew went above and beyond to work with us to make sure that our household goods could be delivered on time, even going as far as to put extra guys on the job to get it done so that we didn't have to reschedule our move.

3. Their work is phenomenal. They painted all interior walls, ceilings and trim for us (including doors), but the thing that stood out the most to us was how they fixed the trim that the previous homeowners had installed. Before, it had cracks and looked DIY. After Green Valley, it looks brand new and 100% professionally installed with all the previous flaws gone.

I don't know how they're pricing compares since they were the only quote we were able to do, but I believe they are well worth the cost of their services. Every interaction with this team from the owner, Ian, down to the members of the crew was professional and positive. We cannot recommend them enough!< /text>

<user>106842108571875306143<//user>< name>
Rebecca burns-dimarino</name>
< Date>
1595880080992< /Date>
< rating>
5<//rating>
< text>
It was my first time having to go through this process.  I received bids from multiple companies throughout my area.  I did a lot of research on the type of paint as well as research on the requirements of a company.  It was easy for me to exclude the bids that were at a lower price, as these companies were not licensed and bonded, and the savings was not worth it to me to risk going with cheaper companies.  When I narrowed it down to two different companies, there was a difference of $1000.00 between them as well as a difference in the paint material.  When I questioned Green Valley Painting about the paint material (which was Elastomeric Paint) and the experience of the painters using the material, the owner of the company Ian Lillibridge personally came out to my home to address the questions that I had, and had assured me that for these types of painting projects, they only use Elastomeric paint and would not suggest any other type of paint for their customers.   When I questioned the competing company (who was using the best Acrylic paint), they stated (over the phone) that my home was not in bad enough shape to require Elastomeric Paint, but if I insisted on the product, they would provide me an estimate for the product.  Their estimate came at a few hundred dollars less than Green Valley Painting. What were my deciding factors on selecting Green Valley Painting over the other?  For one:  this is an investment into my home.  I made it clear to Ian, when he offered to look at my bid and see if he could reduce it, that for me it wasn't about getting the cheaper deal, it was about getting a worth while investment. I was under the impression that Ian too saw this as a worthwhile investment for all of his customers, and therefor only uses Elastomeric Paint for these types of jobs.  This lead me to also believe that his painting crew had the experience necessary to properly apply the Elastomeric Paint (which through my research, I had found that if applied incorrectly, issues would occur and the product would not work as it was intended for).  I did not feel the same confidence in the other company.  For two:  Elastomeric paint is rated to last longer than the best Acrylic paint (when applied properly), this was a worthwhile investment and as stated previously, I was lead to believe that Green Valley Painting has the knowledge and experience to properly apply the Elastomeric paint.  For Three:  the company really took care of me, answering the million questions that I had, walking me through each step of the process multiple times and working with me on the timing of when my home would be painted (this was all being handled during the covid pandemic crisis)  For Four:  I was explaining the adventure of finding a painting company and selecting Green Valley Painting to a friend of mine, who in turn, also had his house painted by Green Valley Painting BEFORE me and he was absolutely impressed with the work that this company had done.  This in turn assured me that I did select the right company and I felt confident in going through with the having them paint my home.  Was everything 100% perfect, absolutely not, there was some minor issues that in my opinion were bound to happen, but were handled relatively quickly.  I would absolutely, without a doubt, use this company again.  I do have an interior painting job that if I decide not to go through the hassle of painting it myself, I would call on this company to do it for me.

I have provided a before and after picture in this review</text>

<user>111665377525402057580< /user><user_name>Gigi Reloj<//user_name><Time>1513641849977<//Time>< Rate>
5< /Rate>
< Review>
I don't review on any site much, but for a big job like this, it was worth my time to give them props! If you've painted a house before (interior or exterior), you may be privy to all the minor details. I've painted the interior walls of all the places I've lived in...and I must say, I'm pretty anal when it comes to the little details. A friend of mine, who's very thorough when it comes to finding quality products and service, used Green Valley for their home (exterior). I would come over every now and again and see the attention to detail and speed in which the painters worked. So why recreate the wheel when my friend did all her homework? So we hired them too. As most reviewers said, they are not the cheapest (nor the most expensive); but the fairest. My home is finished, and is, honestly, in better shape than how the builders left it (we bought this home brand new). Green Valley Painting caulked around every window and flashing...I don't think I'll ever have to worry about water seeping through and causing dry rot!! We work hard for the meager monies we have, so it is important that we spend it wisely. In this case, money was well spent now for a beautiful home and a worry-free future!<//Review>

I didn't expect that.

<Review>I have always felt extremely well-taken-care-of by Coco and crew. Admittedly, I don't know a lot about cars. But with two cars now, they have given me solid advice, reasonable prices, - and told me when work could wait vs. when it could not. I really trust these guys!< /Review></record></dataset><record>
< UserId.>
116393045514423007082</UserId.>
< username>
Tony Vega</username>
< Date>
1414689226866< /Date>
<rate>5<//rate>< review>
I highly recommend Nono's 76. I moved nearby and had no idea where to go when my car needed service, and with that came the fear of unknown mechanics working on my beloved Mazda 3. I called AAA and they gave me a list of recommended mechanics in my area. I picked this one and never looked back. Coco, the guy you usually talk to when you bring you car in, is great. He's always given me a competitive deal, better than dealerships, and he takes time to understand the issue and explain the technical stuff when you ask. This place doesn't spend all their money on a luxurious waiting room with 3 plasma TVs etc, it's cozy and modest so you're just paying less to fix your car instead of more to have a massage chair and martini machine while you're waiting. Honesty, great prices and fast, great service!</review>

<review>While Brian, Coco and Fari are as nice as can be, please think twice about leaving you car here for repairs. After my car being in their possession for a month I am forced to file a complaint with the Better Business Bureau as well as the Bureau of Automotive Repair.
Albeit long, here is my story.

They have had my car for 4 weeks now for a repair to pass smog. Against my knowing, they are having it repaired by another shop.

Brought my 1991 VW Vanagon in to Nono's 76 to have it smogged on Sept 8. Was told it will take 25 minutes. 45 minutes later I noticed that people that have come in after me are leaving. Turns out the machine my car was on was bad. Asked the tech about it and he yelled at me and my wife. After an hour and a half, car is done and failed smog.

Upholstery and interior is filthy with grease. Am given a coupon for a car wash.

I am assured by Fari (the supervisor) that they have an expert mechanic who is great with VW vans and that Fari himself had one and has experience working on them. Left it there that day and requested an oil change since it was there anyway. Called to inquire 2 days later and am told that it is done but something has happened during the process that has made the van run poorly. Am asked to test drive it and see for myself. Drive it home and keep it overnight. Car has very little power and is stalling out. Bring it back the next day and talk to Coco who tells me that they weren't even the ones who did the repairs. Ask who did them and he tells me he'll find out. Also tells me that something shorted out while the new catalytic converter was being welded in. They forgot to do the oil change.

Call a couple days later and find out that the car is over at Kartek Mufflers and they are the ones who are working on it. Call a couple times more and speak to Coco who tells me it's not done yet. He eventually hands me back over to Fari who says that Kartek needs an air flow meter and can't find one. Asks me to check to see if I can find one. He might have a lead on a used one. Give him 2 places that have them. 2 days later he tells me they are out of stock. I call that day and find out that that is not true. Fari says that he told his clerk to order it and that's what he told him.

Stop off at Kartek and get their side of the story. Eddie at Kartek tells me that nothing shorted out while they were welding and he just needs the new air flow meter and the car will be fine. Part comes in and I call to see when the van is ready. Eddie tells me that it's done but not running great (which it was when I dropped it off - Drove to San Diego and back without a problem) I take it home for the weekend and the same problem exists. Car has a bit more power but is now hesitating and surging. Stalls again. Bring it back to Eddie and he tells me that he didn't have time to make the needed adjustments on the new air flow meter and wants to call the company where it was purchased to make sure the adjustments won't void the warranty. It is now 3 weeks later.

Call Eddie on Oct 1 (Mind you I have no agreement with Eddie at Kartek to do any repairs. If it were up to me I would have brought it to my VW specialist). Eddie tells me the mechanic who was working on it has not been at work all week because his dog was sick. I am assured that the mechanic is back and will be working on my van and it will be ready on Friday. Call on Friday and am told that they were very busy and that he will definitely have it done on Saturday. Call 3 times on Saturday and am eventually told that they did not get to it and it will be ready on Monday.

Called Fari and explain the situation to him and tell him I'm filing a complaint since I did not authorize this 3rd party to work on the car and after almost 1 month I do not have it. I am seeking a refund to 1. Pay for my rental car for the last month and 2. to pay for my personal mechanic to fix the problem.<//review>< user>

<Rate>5</Rate><review>To be quite honest, Elephant Rock does not resemble an elephant.  It is a beautiful rock composed of ancient, 150 million year old pillow lava that was formed by underwater eruptions and similar to rocks found on the Atlantic Ridge today.  It is a truly unique formation.  Other rocks on the beach are also ancient.  The pretty red or green pebble you may find be 150 million years old.</review><Pics>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOVop_JBYuqiKEX-LtUdq52CqHTEaKZv1KAHQJy=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]</Pics>< Resp>

<user_id>113730986152314353836</user_id>< name>
Mjinga Safi</name>
<Date>1524031850521< /Date><Rate>5< /Rate>< Text>
I usually go to this Baskin-Robbins when I need me some Baskin-Robbins, and I never thought to post a review one way or the other. But, having now been in a number of other BR establishments culminating in Mocha Cappuccino Blast With Armpit, I can definitively say this is the cleanest BR of them all, with excellent service and lovely employees. I did not realize what I was taking for granted before, but now I do, and I'm positively delighted that this BR is the closest one to me. A truly wonderful example of excellent service and, most importantly, spotlessly clean hygiene. Oh, and the owner (or maybe the co-owner or owner's wife, I'm not 100% which of them actually owns it) is a gem of a woman. <3<//Text>

<pics>None</pics><user_name>JJ Johnson<//user_name><Rating>5</Rating>< user_id>
116980230344737894494</user_id>
< Text>
I love ice cream. What I love most about Baskin-robbins is the 31 flavors I get to choose from. This BK has been in Redlands as long as I can remember. The employees are always friendly, and the service is top notch. There is very little seating inside (4 two-person tables) but there are at least 8 benches, with shade, on the corner outside. By far, my favorite flavor is World Class Chocolate. It combines a milk chocolate and white chocolate ice cream into an incredible creamy creation. If you are ever in downtown Redlands and you need a cool treat, head on over to 31 flavors and get your fill of fabulous ice cream. As always, your mileage may vary!< /Text>

I use to live across the street from this Rite Aid-- so unfortunately, I had little choice but to shop here sometimes. The cashier ALWAYS made rude personal remarks about the items I was buying. They never knew where to find things or would tell me they didn't have something, but after searching for a long time-- I'd find it.
One extremely rude remark was made when my husband and I were trying to conceive. I ran down to Rite Aid to buy a pregnancy test (because I was SO excited that I might be pregnant). The cashier kept trying to refer me to  Planned Parenthood. When I tried to laugh off her insensitive remarks, she made a comment that heavily implied that I should get an abortion...
I stopped shopping there immediately, and I'm so glad I moved away from Ocean Beach so I could take my business elsewhere.
Shame on you, Rite Aid cashiers.</review>

< user_id>
113323883986012618493</user_id>
< Name>
Ben Orooji< /Name>
< Gmap_id>
0x80dce9e226181407:0x9e39733061dd57f4<//Gmap_id>
< pics>
None< /pics>
< text>
This barbershop has a classic old world feel  with a sports theme that caters to guys. You'll be offerred a water or beer, and there are individual televisions at each station if you want to watch something. No ungodly chemical stink when you walk in thank goodness, one of my pet peeves.

I've had several barbers here, my favorite is Hamid, who always does an excellent job. The real selling point though is that my wife says Hamid cuts my hair better than anyone ever has. That's the best endorsement I can think of. You can expect a bit of pampering here, hot towels, short massage, etc. but this is still a barbershop and not a salon. I like that.

They do offer shaves and such that I haven't taken advantage of yet, maybe I will at some point.

The owner is usually present who mans the front end. He's personable enough and it's nice to see he cares to  keep a watch over his business.

Bottom line: great place for a cut, and try Hamidüòä< /text>

<date>1542236830207<//date><Rate>5</Rate><text>There is something to be said about someone who takes their job and in this case "craft" very seriously. You don't have to be a Dr or lawyer in this world to be successful, having a trade is to be admired. In this case I'm talking about a gentleman named Nampo. He's first chair at V's and deserves it. I can't speak to his skills concerning cutting hair because he only gave me a straight razor shave and a facial massage. He did however, without asking, put his personal touch fine tuning my neck and hairline. Square cut wasn't good enough for him and I happily agreed. I've had a straight razor shave many times but Nampo's attention to detail was terrific. Plenty of hot towels, warm shave cream and a gentle touch made for a relaxing experience. The chair is old school and comfortable. The confidence he had in handling the blade showed many years of experience. When he was done he put some sort of liquid mask on my face that tightened up every last pore. It was an interesting feeling as the mask dried and almost stretched my face tight. That was removed by another hot towel followed by several more lotions and a fall asleep massage. Cost $35 shave + $35 massage. Time 1 hour. Value worth every penny!<//text><user>112988063776526940803</user>< Resp>

< Text>
Look... I went here once and got a decent haircut from a barber named Napo. He did a clean job on a classic combover style haircut the first time. I went in the second time and asked him to define my part a little bit and give me a low fade. He had no idea what he was doing. His idea of a fade was to buzz one side of my head without any blending whatsoever. I literally could of taken a 2 guard and raked it through my hair to do the job he did. It is one of the worst haircuts I've ever had. I didn't  bother even fighting it, I paid and left. He even apologized for not doing what I asked but excused it by saying this is what the young kids like. I'm not a hipster in high school, I like a traditional clean cut look. Now I have to wait a month for my hair to recover. I'm truly embarrassed walking around in public this haircut and will not be going back. < Text>
Food is delicious. 5 stars. But...

Minus one star because I've only got a 50% success rate of getting "very spicy" when I order. Tonight I specified max spicy, saw "2 stars" on the receipt when I picked up my order, then got home to find no chili in my dish whatsoever. I got more of a burn from my piping hot soup than I did from my main dish.

Please. When I say "extra spicy" I MEAN IT. Don't give me Midwestern White Guy spicy. It's enough to make me stop ordering.<//Text>

<user_id>115215290468426205833< /user_id>< name>
david kranker<//name>
<Time>1620674741167</Time><Rate>1< /Rate>< text>
This place used to be my favorite Thai spot, but they renovated during the pandemic and added a new seating area and it appears that they cannot keep up with the increase of dine in customers.  I have ordered from here 3 times in the past month and every time it takes at least twice as long as the wait time they give you.  The first time I went back it took an hour and 20 minutes for egg rolls and a noodle dish (they were packed I will give them that) the second time I went back I gave them an extra 10 min until I drove over to get my food and they forgot to put in my order they said it will be ready in 10 minutes, I come back and they forgot to put in my order the second time as well, making me wait around an hour and a half again, for egg rolls and a noodle dish, this last time I went they gave me a 30 minutes wait time, I came 30 min late anticipating the super long wait, and still had to wait another 30 min in the restaurant so it took them an another hour and a half to make my food and they skimped me on an egg rolls on top of all of that, once again this place used to be my favorite Thai place, but because of these experiences I‚Äôve had since the remodel I cannot say that I will be returning even though the food is amazing I cannot deal with the wait times being 3X longer than they tell me and skimping me on top of all of it.  Hope you guys can get it together at some point.</text>

<user_id>113705334683216808698<//user_id><Gmap_id>0x80c2baa2c1ad9729:0xe8c4b9f601081a5f<//Gmap_id>< Text>
Excellent service and quality!

The menu was clean and organized. Finally a menu with lots of nice pictures of foods. Excellent and so helpfulI. I wish other restaurant's menu could have more pictures.

The staff were kind and helpful.

As we entered in to the restaurant during lunch time, many visitors were there to eat.

We were quickly helped to sit down at a table and right away and another waitress came to receive our order.

We ordered several different dishes. The food were hot, fresh and tasted excellent!

The amount of salt in the food was ok but the amount of sugar in salads and other dishes were more than expected. We wish the sugar could be less and they could serve some sugar at side so the customer themself can decide how much sugar they want to add.

The waiting time from order to be served was ok.

The restroom:
We didn't see any restroom. Does this place have restroom?

< Rate>
5</Rate>
<response>None< /response><Date>1621138010906</Date><user_name>Blaine Billingsley<//user_name><GmapID>0x80c2baa2c1ad9729:0xe8c4b9f601081a5f< /GmapID><Pictures>None< /Pictures><Review>Best Thai food!</Review><user_id>106439880997368623776< /user_id></record></dataset><record>
< text>
What a wonderful place.  We stopped here after touring the Venice Canal houses.  We had the Krispy Ka Prao Chicken and the Roasted Duck Curry with a side of white, steamed rice.

First, the ambiance is just amazing. We sat outside, our table overlooking the canal, a fresh breeze lightly blowing in on a warm and sunny winter day.

The chicken was tender, falling off the bone, with a sticky, crispy skin and crispy basil. I probably could have eaten another entire serving.  The curry had a beautiful kick of spice to it and the duck was tasty.

The service was great too.  The server kept our water glasses full and checked in on us several times.

We would definitely return here again.<//text>
< Date>
1583850607843<//Date>

<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< text>
Superb, authentic Thai food. We cook and travel internationally a lot and are choosy about where we eat, but this restaurant was so good we ate here two days in a row.

For salads, we loved the glass noodle salad as well as the papaya salad (Som Tum). The Siamese Hot Pot Delight soup is delicious and lovely. The Deep Sea Diamond from the specialty menu was also great. Even the mango sticky rice had a special touch. Oh, and their fresh coconuts are delicious! Very fresh.

The patio is lovely in good weather and they have kind service.<//text>

< Review>
Great little place right on the side of the canals walkway. Seated in a timely manner outside. The staff was hurrying around and doing their job. We ordered 2 entrees, this is where the problem started. My Pad Thai arrived in about 10 minutes, quick for how busy they were however my guest ordered the Emerald Curry arrived 15 minutes after mine. When questioned about this the staff had no excuse and just said sorry. This to me is totally unacceptable and a total failure on the front and back of house communication. The food was great, the timing was terrible.< /Review>

After she finished yelling I called my family and told them we couldn't eat there because we felt so unwelcome. Who does that? 114791754130317763485< /userid>
<username>Cheryl Miller</username><time>1471361974024< /time><Rate>1<//Rate>< review>
Was looking forward to a romantic dinner in this small intimate restaurant. A total disaster!! My husband's food arrived, and after 20 minutes of waiting for my dinner, I finally asked the waiter in charge about my dinner. He informed me that the chicken I had ordered took 20 minutes and the  waitress was new, and had not informed me the wait. I told him she should not have brought my husband's dinner way before mine was ready! I did not receive my dinner, and eventually asked the waiter to cancel my order as my husband was finished eating. I asked for something already prepared and choose the chicken sticks and friedrice. I received a huge mound of rice and 4-5 chicken sticks. My original order had not been removed from the bill! We finally settled the bill and it was $20.00 for my part, which was 4-5 chicken sticks and some refried rice. No comp was given for the long delay!! Would never go back to that restaurant!!<//review>

< text>
Bought my car in Nov 2020 with Beau and discussed the details behind the Service package with William. Great people to work with! I never felt pressured.

I've had my 2020 Subaru Impreza Premium for 5 months now, and I absolutely love it! Previously I had driven a 2008 Saturn Ion and a 2013 Kia Rio, so this is a slight change for me. Overall, the one thing I love is how secure the car feels.

Also, I love that I can schedule my appointment with the MySubaru app. The reminders (via phone call) are very helpful as well. The associates are very kind to talk to. Lastly, I had bought the Service package when I bought my car, so dropping off my car for it's 6-month/6,000 mile service was so easy! The associate I worked with (David) was welcoming and helpful. Updated 7/15/2019, downgraded to 2 stars

1. Was never called back with an estimate on cost or part delivery after scheduling online
2. Was turned away at my scheduled appointment time because of some random inspection
3. Came back a few hours later only to find out the part I needed was not in stock and would then take a few more days to order (see comment #1) and promised the have repairs done by Thurs of the same week.
4. Receive phone call on Thurs to tell me the part is in and schedule appointment, then told that next available appointment is the following week.
5. Ask to speak to a manager, nobody answers the phone. Manager doesn't call back themselves and pushes it off to someone else (obviously doesn't care about their customers)
6. Finally have service done the following week, no status updates as end of day and close of business for the service center is approaching.
7. Repairs were done correctly (although technically not even done by Steven's Creek Subaru, a 3rd party comes in to replace windshields).

< rate>
2<//rate>
<text>Not sure how friendly they actually are... I've called 60 minutes before they closed yesterday, and it kept going through a phone loop. I tried selecting "Operator", "Service Department", "Parts" NO ONE answered. I repeated the same this morning and after the forth loop through the "to connect to ..." message I finally got through. The conversation went like this: ME: "I see your site says it takes 3 days to do the recall fix. Is that true? Or do you have the parts in stock?" THEM: It only takes a day, but a full day, would you like to schedule an appointment?  ME: Yes, can I drop it off for "early bird" tomorrow?  THEM: No, you have to be present.  ME: Ok, then when is your earliest appointment tomorrow?  THEM: Would you like me to schedule an appointment? ME: Yes, when is your earliest appointment tomorrow?  THEM: We have today and tomorrow available. But you have to be present to get a loaner.  ME: Oh, a loaner, then I will take your first available appointment. When is that? THEM: We have both today and tomorrow. {CLICK}.

I get the distinct impression that either they try to be inept to NOT handle the recall, or that the person I spoke with simply doesn't understand English (though she certainly sounded like a native speaker). I was using a landline, and the conversation sounded very clear to me.

So fast forward a few days. I had similar problem connecting with another Dealership, so went online and simply made an 8:15 am appointment. The website wasn't so great... after answering a ton of questions (including that it was an airbag recall fix), it said "what service do you need?" Sigh.

I brought my Forester in the next morning a bit before 8 am. There was a huge crush of people and it took about an hour before they got to my car. Another 15 minutes or so later I was on my way out - my wife took me home. The agent (friendly and helpful - and angry about the lack of training for the person who handled the call) said service would be completed the next day at or before noon. At noon the next day I hadn't heard from my service agent, but since we were in the neighborhood just before noon we dropped by... then went to lunch and did some shopping when they said it would be an hour or so longer. It actually finished about 4:15 PM.

The new problem: about 2 hours outside of the Bay Area on our way down south, the right passenger window molding came loose. It doesn't appear that it is possible to put it back in place without some sort of additional repair.  Now we're back in town and I'm not relishing going through the phone tree fiasco again to get this thing repaired.

On the positive side, I did ask them to make two other repairs: replacing a bad tire pressure sensor, and refitting my driver door panel. The charges for those two fixes were very reasonable.  Due to my in person experience being mostly good, I've upped them to two stars. If I can get the last bit of the fix completed, I might even go 3 stars.... because the other Subaru dealer in San Jose is outright dishonest.  I'll take phone clumsy dealers over cheats any day!< /text>< Pics>

Highlights: BE PREPARED deceitful "financial manager", poor documentation, lack of knowledge from "financial managers", confrontational, aggressive.

I would like to start by saying that anyone who wants to avoid a stereo typically sleazy car buying experience, does not feel comfortable with one-on-one negotiations, or has not completed thorough research should actively avoid Stevens Creek Subaru because of their "financial managers."¬†I've been considering what I've wanted in my next car for some time now, so after months of research and discussion with friends, I found ‚Äúmy‚Äù car, the 2017 Subaru Forester Touring. And I mean it was MY car.. this car had everything I could ask for: rich brown leather interior, adaptive cruise control for the stop-and-go Bay Area traffic, all-wheel drive for those long weekends to Tahoe, and a jaw-dropping panoramic moon roof for stargazing in Yosemite. There it was, I found ‚Äúmy‚Äù car at Stevens Creek. It seemed like an easy process as the sale started: test drive, discuss specifications, and finally we talk price. I settled on a price the car as well as an extended warranty that was more than fair. And that's when the real Stevens Creek Subaru car buying experience began: with ‚Äúfinancial manager‚Äù Luis. Once I agreed on a price for the vehicle, ¬†I was asked how I would be financing. Early in the negotiations, I had asked if there was an incentive for a well-qualified buyer financing through the dealership.The answer was no.¬† Luis was flabbergasted that I had secured my own financing, but this didn‚Äôt deter the sale. I was prompted to fill out some information, but soon realized that this information was a credit application. Since I had my own financing, I was confused. I went to clarify and was immediately confronted by another ‚Äúmanager‚Äù exclaiming ‚ÄúYOU DO WANT THE 1.99% FINANCING DON‚ÄôT YOU?!" Soon this manager realized I wasn‚Äôt financing with them and went into a sob story about how they weren‚Äôt previously paid for a vehicle off the lot. I agreed and they saw my 803 credit score and continued with the sale of the car. I should have left after this experience but again it was ‚Äúmy‚Äù vehicle, so how do I walk away? Luis led me to his office to begin signing papers, and began expanding on the warranty. I asked for clarifying details about what was covered. He couldn‚Äôt provide any specifics aside from a small pamphlet with buzzwords of *electronics*, *power steering*, and *air conditioning*. Since he wouldn‚Äôt provide a more detailed answer, I asked to discuss the price of the warranty further. Luis was getting uncomfortable, so I asked who dictated the price of the warranty and the deductible. Initially he stated that Subaru wouldn‚Äôt allow certain concessions, so I asked another question on the price, and he followed up with that pricing was specific to ‚Äúcity,region, and dealership.‚Äù And so Luis contradicted himself for the first time that night. I accepted this because it felt like minor details about the car I was dreaming of.As we continued with the car buying process, we reviewed the service history documented in Subaru‚Äôs log. This CERTIFIED PREOWNED CAR had two dead batteries in the span of two months. I asked further questions about what this could mean. In response, I was told that the batteries had been replaced with OEM parts and it was no longer an issue. I went to sign the Carfaxf or the process of the CPO vehicle only to realize that the only service history that was listed was from the most recent certification for the CPO.This really bothered me because it made no mention of the two visits for the drained batteries. At this point I said I would be more than happy to sign the Subaru service records that reflected the actual maintenance on the car but I would not be signing the Carfax because it didn‚Äôt truly paint the whole picture.I was told this could not happen and that I could leave from the deal if I wanted. After a four-hour ordeal,¬† I did decide to walk away because of the discrepancies in the documentation as well as the unethical tactics used by the ‚Äúfinancial managers."</review>

<review>It makes me quite sad to write this review, as I'd previously had some good experiences at Steven's Creek Subaru (hence 2 stars instead of 1), but this latest experience was so bad that I feel the need to do this.

Last week, I brought my Outback in for an oil change and to get some leaky hoses in the windshield fluid system fixed. They did the oil change, but charged me quite a lot to simply tell me what I'd already told them about the hoses (that they were leaking) and nothing more. That alone would have been bad, but upon leaving I discovered that there was now a rattling/wobbling noise coming from my car that had not been there before. This concerns me as a potential safety issue, and I have been very hesitant to drive since.

That alone would be bad, but it would be forgivable if Steven's Creek Subaru could fix the issue that they caused. 20+ phone calls and an email to the manager later, and I have still be unable to get in contact with anyone. That includes messages left with two different operators who told me that nobody from the services department was available, but that one would call me back as soon as they were. I guess that department has been running 24/7 without even a minute to spare, because I have never received a single call.

This level of negligence is extremely disrespectful to customers. Combining that with high prices for substandard work leaves me feeling taken advantage of and ignored. Once a long-time customer, I will not be returning.

EDIT: Please do not mistake the responses to reviews like mine by Steven's Creek Subaru for genuine interest in the issues expressed by its customers. It's abundantly clear that this organization's propensity for ignoring phone calls and refusing to return messages extends right to the very top.</review>< user_id>

< review>
I brought my vehicle in for service on July 12 with a request to look into a chirping sound when the clutch was disengaged. I was contacted by Edwin, my service rep, that evening and told that the noise was being caused by a bad throwout bearing that he had confirmed with his manager was under warranty. However, there were vehicles ahead of mine and it would take 2-3 weeks to begin the repair and that I would be contacted then to get a replacement vehicle. I left the vehicle at the shop pending the repair.

I contacted Edwin again on July 25 to inquire as to whether the repair had been started. I expressed concern that I had plans coming up the weekend of the 30th. I was told that the shop was not ready to begin the repair and that I should pick up my vehicle. I would be contacted the following week to get a replacement vehicle and start the repair, which should be about two weeks.

A week and a half later I called again to find out where things were at. The service rep that answered my call informed me he would look into the matter and get back to me. I never received a call back and my follow-up call went to voicemail. It is then that I submitted the 2 star rating since I was feeling like I was being ignored and had been waiting 4 weeks for a repair I was told would take 2-3 weeks.

Ron left a message expressing concern at my rating and I called back again a week later and found out that the service representative that I had been working with was no longer with the shop. I asked to speak to Ron, who was not available, and was told he would call me back. I never received a call back from Ron.

I happened to be near the shop for a family event on August 22 and I stopped in and followed up in person. After looking into the issue for a bit, I was brought into the service manager's office to speak to Gary. I was told that there was a back up in the heavy lane and that they would be able to start work in 2 weeks.

I called back again the morning of September 7 to find out if I could bring my vehicle in since the two weeks had past without incident. I was asked to work with Caesar as my service representative, who informed me he would look into whether the parts and a replacement vehicle were ready and that they would call me back. Again, I received no call back.

After following up several times without response, I reached Jonathan on Caesar's day off the week of September 24. He did call me back and informed me that the car was in queue but would be another two weeks due to the backup.

I was again in the area and followed up in person on October 7. During my visit I discovered that Caesar was no longer working with the dealership and was told that they would leave a message with Gary to get back to me on Tuesday. I received a call on Wednesday informing me that Charles would be taking over as my service rep. He had spoken with Gary, confirmed that the repair was under warranty and was putting my car in queue for repair. I was told I should expect a call back when my car comes up for repair but that there is a backup in the heavy lane.

It's been three months that I have been waiting for a repair that I have now been told on 5 occasions would take 2 weeks. After having bought two cars from this dealership I am seriously questioning why I would ever buy here again because the service department is a joke.< /review>

< UserId.>
102053369554485125483<//UserId.>
< Review>
We purchased our car here and have had it serviced here since then, but we've been repeatedly underwhelmed with the experience.

When we first bought our Subaru, we were talked into pre-paying for service for the first few years. The way the contract was written, that deal expired after a certain number of service appointments or a number of years. I pointed out that since we expected our car to be a low-mileage vehicle, it would probably be a long time between services, so pre-paying didn't make sense. The seller said he understood and altered the contract such that there was no expiration date -- it was simply based on a number of pre-paid service visits.

Fast-forward a few years later and I found it impossible to redeem our pre-paid service visits. They explained that "our policy has changed" and they needed to respect the expiration. I explained that I had our contract specifically altered to prevent that. Long story short, I double-paid for years of service.

It only got worse when we had to bring in our vehicle for a recall. We made an appointment and brought the car in on the weekend only to have it explained to us that we'd need to leave the vehicle with them for TWO MONTHS. Most of that time, it would just be sitting there in a queue. As an alternative, we could keep our own car while we waited in the queue and they'd call us in a few weeks when they had time to service our vehicle.

When I asked why I needed to waste my weekend bringing in the car when we could have handled the exchange over the phone, they explained, "It's our policy." Apparently, it's their policy to waste their customers' time.

When we finally did get through the queue, we were told the service would take "a week and a half to two weeks." After three weeks I called for an update, but since I could only get updates from my designated service advisor, who works on an odd schedule, I had trouble finding out anything. In the end, it took a month to get the recall completed, not including the month and a half of waiting time.

To their credit, they provided a loaner vehicle while mine was serviced. At the first appointment, I explained that I'd need to travel with my dog and they said "of course" that was no problem. But when I actually picked up the loaner vehicle, they said "no dogs allowed." It's hard to say why as the loaner vehicle was filthy, complete with sticky soda spills and a center console filled the personal possessions of the previous driver.< /Review>

<user>101207508766833542939</user>< review>
I entered my car in for routine service. Part of the plastic surrounding near the windshield wipers flipped up over my windshield while I was driving home on the freeway. It seems to have been snapped at the clip, and in the same area the windshield has a crack, if I had to guess, something was dropped on the car in this area which caused this.

So pretty disappointed at that. I called right after this happened and asked to speak to the general manager, and after being put through to multiple "how can I direct your call"'s, someone finally told me he wasn't in, but he would call me tomorrow. But I've not received a call still.  I received a follow up email, (which had nothing to do with my complaint), and I posted all of this in reply, no response from that either.

So I‚Äôve got a broken part, a cracked windshield, and no one will even talk to me. At this point I‚Äôm cutting my losses and will continue to go to my original Subaru dealer, even though it is 2 hours away.

Also the courtesy shuttle service was abysmal. Us three passengers needed to constantly tell the driver where to go, even though we'd given him addresses and he'd put these into his phone. He had Google maps open in front of him and continued to take wrong turns and also ask us where to go (with the map in front of him..). The trip from the dealership to my work took nearly an hour. Given that it's 6.5 miles I really should have just taken an Uber.

The estimates for service time were also a bit annoying. Generally when I ask how long it will take, other dealerships are pretty accurate. 2 hours usually means 1 hour 45 mins. In the case here, I dropped off my car at 7 when my appointment was, I was told 2 hours, which fit well with my work schedule. At 10:30 I still hadn't heard anything so I called in, then at 12:25 I finally got the call that my car was ready.  I've got no problems with the service taking 5 hours, but just tell me 5 hours at the start... Don't tell me 2, because I will plan my day around that.

Anyway, I hate giving negative feedback, as I generally love the service I get at Subaru but I definitely won't be returning to Steven's creek.< /review>

< time>
1475537034726<//time>
<rate>1</rate>< Text>
I brought my 2013 Outback to the dealership in Sunnyvale for an oil consumption test.  They change my car oil and told me to bring it back after  1200 miles which I did. They checked the oil level and told me that there was no drop in the oil level so that was the end of the test.  I didn't understand why test was designed for only 1200 miles.  My car burned 1.5-2 quarts of oil in between oil change which is every 7000 miles!  So I called another dealership at Capital Subaru and they told me that I can take the test up to 3 times, bringing the car in every 1200 miles for a total of 3600 miles.  I called the Sunnyvale dealership back and told them what the Capital Subaru dealership told me and asked them why would they only give the oil test for 1200 mile and the person that responded (Dante?) said that was the guideline from Subaru of America. Of course I followed up with SoA and here's their response:
"The oil consumption testing specification is up to 1 Quart in 3,600 miles. In this testing, the retailer changes your oil and you return several times at 1,200 mile intervals without adding any oil to the engine. This allows the retailer to establish the precise oil usage of your engine. "

So either he didn't know what he was talking about or he didn't want to be bothered with my problem.  You can imagine my frustration with this dealership.</Text>

<UserId.>104161172155847573394<//UserId.><user_name>Trung Trinh< /user_name><time>1346798823918</time>< rate>
3</rate>
< Review>
I bought my SO at this dealership, and have been taking my car here for regular service for a couple of years. However, I'm calling it quit and taking my car else where for service. The service reps are nice, but the mechanics (at least the ones doing oil change) are terrible.

When I first bought the car, I also purchased the Teflon package. So I left the car there over night for the Teflon coating. However, when I went to pick up the car, I noticed they detailed the car but didn't applied the Teflon coating as promised. The sales rep checked, confirmed, and I had to leave the car there for an additional day for the job to be done right. This is a clear indication that I should take my car else where, but I thought it could be an honest mistake.

Over the 2 years that I've taken my car to Stevens Creek Subaru for regular service, they've forgotten to put the oil cap back on, didn't change the service sticker, and among others. The final straw for me was this last service, where they didn't tighten the oil pan nut. So oil was leaking all over my driveway. I took it back and they fixed it, but I had to really cleanup all the oil leaked on my driveway.

My Outback is about due for major services, such as brakes and tune-ups, as it's nearing 45K. My question is if they can't do a simple oil service right consistently, how can I trust them to take care of the more important services. The answer is I can't. So I'm going else where.

I took my Outback to another dealership today and request a history of the services done on my car. It turns out, that the folks at Stevens Creek Subaru didn't complete all the items they were supposed to do, and some are done out of order. This is alarming to me. So my recommendation to Stevens Creek Subaru owner, is to evaluate and revamp the service dept. to get it in order. I'm also recommending other Subaru owners to take their vehicle else where, until Stevens Creek Subaru dealership have fixed the service dept and is more reliable/dependable.<//Review>

<rating>1< /rating>< review>
Absolutely terrible service department. Completely ignored me when I came in for my appointment. After standing around for twenty minutes, the person I was supposed to see walked out of the building, and the other workers had to run around looking for him. My issue (broken windshield due to a defect) had an NTSB notice that it should be repaired asap and that the dealer should not go through the usual warranty authorization steps. I tried to tell then this and was ignored. I even had the NTSB notice with me and they refused to look at it.

I thought ok, it'll just take an extra week for the authorization. Next up, they had to take pictures of the crack on the windshield. Took three separate attempts because the guy kept messing up when entering them on the computer. On the last try I knew he screwed up again, and sure enough later that night he called me to say I had to come in next week to redo the pictures because he messed up.

Instead I went to Premiere Subaru of Fremont. They were extremely professional and courteous, read through the NTSB notice and realized they didn't need to do the warranty authorization, took a few pictures (and got it right the first time), and ordered a new windshield all within half an hour.< /review>

<review>I brought in a vehicle that had seen the salt of New England and New York for 6 years. I knew the brake pads were worn pretty thin and the car needed regular maintenance anyways.

Sal, my service rep, recommended a change of the entire brake system. Something not cheap, but considering all brake parts were pretty rusted and worn, probably a worthy investment. I'm glad that he was frank about the costs upfront, instead of trying to upsell me after I had agreed to the service.

The service was performed by Nadim, and I can say the brake assembly looked brand new at the end of the service.  Due to the amount of corrosion on the underside of the car, the job ended up taking 2 more days than expected. <date>1535642928024< /date><rating>1<//rating><Review>Updated: 08/30/2018

Terrible service team.

Took my car in months ago for alignment and other maintenance. When I got my car back it was pull to the right really bad. I took my car back in to have that fixed and my head unit replaced (it was previously ordered).

When I picked up my car here is what I found: key fob was broken, dashboard was clearly warped from the head unit swap, they forgot to move over the head  unit memory card and the alignment was not addressed at all. Instead of helping me the service advisor gave me the card of the service manager and told me to deal with the issue with him.

I reached out to the service manager via email with pictures of the issues to get the ball rolling and received no reply for days so I called in and left a voicemail. I still received no reply after a week so I asked for the GM to call me and never received a call back. I had to contact Subaru of America to then reach out to their service manager to call me back.

I brought my car in to service manager (who had no idea why I was there or that he had asked me to come in at 7am). He was very rude and told me this was the last time he would do a "courtesy" request from Subaru for me. That is ridiculous because this was a workmanship issue that I had to waste weeks reaching out to people to get resolved.

So I take my car in again once they received my replacement key. They were asked to address all of the issues- dashboard, key, and alignment. This time when I picked up my car they only fixed the key. The alignment was still pulling and worst of all they said nothing was wrong with the dashboard. I took the service advisor (different from the one that was aware of the issue because he had left for the day) to my car and pointed out the warped material around the head unit. He said he would leave a note for my service advisor to follow up. Of course 2 weeks passed and that never happened.

I called in to setup a new appointment with the original service advisor and brought the car in this morning. I was told that the service advisor was out and would not be back for another week.

This is the type of customer service this dealership provides. The service advisors don't care about you or your car and that is because their service manager doesn't either. All I wanted was to have my issues resolved and nothing beyond that but it is obviously too much to ask.

tl;dr: poor customer service and they don't care</Review>< pics>

< Review>
I am happy to recommend Michael Marsh, my sales consultant at Stevens Creek Subaru. I drove 120 miles from Sacramento to purchase a 2014 Subaru XV Crosstrek, and my experience was worth every mile of the journey! Everyone at the dealership was very friendly. From the moment I stepped onto the lot, I was greeted by a courteous staff and made to feel welcome. The dealership itself is beautiful. Impeccably clean, well stocked and inviting. I contacted Michael Marsh while searching for a specific model with very specific features. He went above and beyond to locate and deliver exactly what I was looking for. He provided accurate information regarding the vehicle, the price I would pay, and the terms by which it would be sold. This is the first time I've ever purchased a Subaru; I only wish I had discovered them sooner! All in all, it was a great purchasing experience. From the start, I was treated with respect and made to feel like a welcome guest. The process of taking delivery was smooth, relaxed and ultimately rewarding. I'm VERY happy with my car. It's everything I had hoped it would be and more! Michael was a joy to work with and I am happy to recommend him to anyone who expresses interest in obtaining a Subaru. He's a gentleman through and through and takes the time to listen to what you want and finds a way to deliver. I'm very grateful for his kind assistance, and for the wonderful atmosphere at Stevens Creek Subaru!</Review>

<Pictures>None</Pictures><review>I came in on Monday to look for a new car (I was initially trying to find a 5 year old used car, but realized that Subaru's retain such a high secondary market price that it was just worth getting a new one).

Came in and met with Chip Miller in their sales team.  I told him my exact situation, what I'm looking for, budget (as well as what I really wanted to spend).  He showed me all the options that fit my criteria, never pushed one or the other.  He did not try to upsell more expensive models, just told me what my options are and answered questions.  I kind of wish he put a bit more pressure on me, as the car that I really originally wanted was sold later that day.  Came in the next day, he worked diligently to match the price/discount of the same car but different color.  Financing for someone like me with so so credit is always a challenge, but their finance person Jason worked with me not just get approval, but layer out various options, we had to go back to the drawing board three times.  Was extremely pleased that the rate was well below what I had anticipated.

After driving off with the car on Tuesday, I came back with some question on Friday.  Even though the sales was complete, Chip took the time again to answer my questions, including walking out to my car and showing me some of the most basic things that I don't know... like how to use bluetooth.

My first car purchase experience was nothing but smooth and efficient, I highly recommend Chip and the team to anybody.

FYI i have also used their services in the past, and I think it's also been very good.  They tell you what is wrong, what they recommend, and various options.< /review>< user_name>

<review>Finance department lied to get a lease done. If you're doing anything out of the ordinary with your car, i.e. traveling, then DO NOT lease from these folks, or at least do your own research and DO NOT trust a word they say. Sales team was great.

UPDATE: Brian contacted me and is making efforts to remedy the situation.

UPDATE 2: Brian Bakhtiari did everything to make this situation right. He agreed we were in an unfortunate situation and put us, the customer, first. I give him a full FIVE STARS. I will be reaching out to the owner of the dealership to inform them of Brian's customer service.

I kept the overall review at four stars since the situation was entirely avoidable if not for the lies of some of the other staff members. Furthermore, Subaru of America was less than helpful. They acknowledged that they "felt bad" for the situation, but couldn't do anything, which is hard for me to believe. Their "apology" wasn't solving my $20,000 problem that was created by their own employees. Such a lack of accountability is disappointing. For transparency, they paid for half of the shipping costs that I had to pay out of my own pocket to send the car back to Stevens Creek. It's a far cry from stellar customer service though.

< text>
I came to Subaru knowing exactly what I wanted. I went to other dealerships that did not take me seriously (Cypress Subaru in Seaside and Capitol Subaru). A couple of minutes after walking into Stevens Creek I found the Crosstrek I was searching for and was greeted by a wonderful salesperson ... Manny!

The negotiating process was made easy with the help of Manny who answered our questions and took charge of our request (we were very specific).  Once his manager Andreas came over to meet us we made our decision. We knew what we wanted, knew what price we wanted to pay and they made it happen for us.

That said, this was my first car purchase and I am happy that Manny, Andreas and even the Finance manager was there to make it easy, painless and straight forward ... even though it was AFTER closing.

I am happy and will refer friends in the future to Stevens Creek Subaru.</text>

< gmapID>
0x808fcae131970085:0x2830ab4a74e22c3b<//gmapID>
<UserId.>118249253523193712937< /UserId.><rate>1<//rate>< Review>
I am a Subaru ambassador, have worked with the company for about two years and have helped about a half dozen folks buy their own Subarus in addition to visiting maybe a dozen or so Subaru dealers. Compared to the competition (even in South Bay) there isn't a lot that Stevens Creek gets right.

Lot: Limited selection, you need to make an appointment to see a car in the configuration you want.

Availability: Even if it's slow, they'll give you a difficult time about walk-in availability. They'll only show you one car, and only in the configuration that's already on the lot. They want to get your information and push you out quickly so that they can get another person in the door. Doesn't matter if you're interested in buying soon, unless you want to buy that day they're not giving you their time.

Service: Service area is very very small. Otherwise it was acceptable, they had wifi, water, some coffee.

Pricing: They will only show you MSRP pricing unless you enter into a serious discussion, they'll try to not provide you with a quote so you don't shop it around to other dealers. Somewhat astonishing compared to every other dealer I've been at.

Salesmanship: Very transactional, not personal. I don't think my salesman told me his name over the hour we spent together. Provided very little information about the vehicle I was test driving other than telling me what I already knew after I would say it, or things very related to what I already knew. They just want your contact information so they can send you mail and email.

Test Drive: This is a big no/no for me, and probably the reason for at least 1.5 stars being deducted. Very very very limited ability to test drive. They'll tell you where to go, it's only on very very nearby roads. They try to make the ride as short as possible so other people can test drive the car. There will be no variations in the drive based on what they know you're interested in. For example: no highway, no parking lot turning radius checks, no differential check (going up a driveway straight on vs at an angle to check for body roll), no time to test the infotainment screen, no ability to test cabin noise at different speeds or on different ground types, no ability to test on speedbumps.

Outcome:
Other than the above, they are reasonably polite, just clearly focused on making their sales. Do yourself a favor and head over to Putnam, Fremont, etc. and shop around a little bit. I would return here for service,  definitely would not buy a car here.

Just a note to Management:
This place strikes me as a place that has run amock in metrics. Namely, Amount of new leads produced, amount of leads closed, highest average cost per sale, amount of walk-ins turned into leads or closed sales, amount of emails sent, amount of calls made, etc. You've forgotten your job is to sell cars that people love, not hit metrics. You're more like a Ford than a Subaru dealer, and you don't align at all with the brand.<//Review>
<response>{'time': 1522168581281, 'text': 'Hello Jonathan, we have seen this review and are concerned with the experience you described. We appreciate feedback like yours because it helps us identify the areas in which we need to improve as a business. If you would like to discuss this issue in more detail, please give me a call so we can work towards a resolution. Your satisfaction is of the utmost importance.\n\nSincerely, Brian Bakhtiari 408-984-2001'}</response>< name>
JDH</name>

I recently purchased a Suburu Forrester from Aydin at Stevens Creek Subaru, before we made our purchase, Aydin was very responsive over the phone and email.
When it came time to work the numbers, I told him I was under time pressure and that I was not interested in a long and drawn out negotiation.  He understood and we landed on a price we both agreed to and made the paperwork smooth and quick as possible.

We went to Stevens Creek Subaru just to look at our options (we were trying to decide between the Toyota Rav 4 and the Subaru Forester).  We had a price in mind and were trading in an 07 Toyota.  Our one other experience buying a car a few years ago from somewhere else was not pleasant, but Chip at Subaru made this experience very painless. < review>
We had a great experience at Stevens Creek Subaru. Our salesperson, Gurpreet, was awesome. He was very transparent and thorough about the buying process. We definitely asked a lot of questions and test drove several cars, several times. He was very patient and responsive throughout, and never pressured or steered us at any time. And, we could have walked away with enough information to shop elsewhere. But, we really appreciated his sales approach, and it was a big factor in why we decided to come back and buy from him.

When we were handed off to Ali (financing) to sign the paperwork on our new Forester, it was a smooth transition. He was calm, patient and very thorough as well. He made sure that we understood everything we were offered, that it was the correct offer (prices, options, etc.), and we understood every document we were about to sign (there are a lot).

Often when you're getting ready to sign paperwork, you're prepared to get hit with all the add-ons (added trim, etc.) and upselling. Ali didn't do that at all (neither did Gurpreet). He offered us the service contract, gap insurance, and warranty which were all practical over the life of the car. No more, no less. It was a relief.

Even though it was the end of the day, there was no rush what so ever. For us, it was a big decision to purchase and we felt like we were in good hands. We felt like both Gupreet and Ali had our best interest at heart and we feel like we made a good decision about the car we bought. Thank you both!<//review>

First of all, I liked the responses of the internet sales manager Andreas, who provided the quote with good price and was quickly and informatively answering all my questions regarding the options and the trim via emails. I received positive decision about the financing in half an hour and quickly finished the paperwork. By the end, I went out with the keys of my new Subaru Impreza 2017 Premium hatchback and I like it very much. The whole process took around 2-3 hours. <Text>For any young car-buyers or anyone interested in the STI...

The incident happened back in September, 2015, when I was in the market for a car in the 30~40k range and wanted to test drive the STI. Before coming to the dealership, I called ahead to make sure they have the configuration I wanted and was promised a test drive. By this time, I had already test driven the 370z ('15), the Mustang GT ('15), and even a Boss Mustang ('12), so I didn't give it a second thought before driving to the dealership...

I was 25, Taiwanese American, and worked as an engineer making 100k/yr at a tech startup. When the salesperson who greeted me found out that I was there to test drive the STI, he said he had to go talk to his managers to get an approval. He came back to me five minutes later, asking what car I drove, to which I responded "2003 VW GTI". The salesperson went back to the manager and related this information, only to come back with "sorry, we don't let people test drive the STI". When I confronted him with the promise made to me over the phone, he returned with "based on the current car owned by our customer, we can tell whether they are sincerely looking to purchase certain vehicles", and that "the STI's are such a rare sports car that we cannot let people put unnecessary miles on them". That was when I realized what was going on... I was being profiled as some teenager with no money and no intention of buying anything, looking for a free joy ride.

It was deeply insulting to be discriminated against, and incredibly shortsighted of the dealership, especially considering its location in the Silicon Valley. When I offered to prove my capability to pay for the STI fully in cash, I was still denied the test drive.

I strongly urge young car-buyers and people shopping for the STI to avoid this Subaru dealership and take their business elsewhere. When I bought a Focus ST after 2 months of car-shopping, this was the ONLY unpleasant incident I'd had with dealerships across the Peninsula.</Text><pics>None< /pics><Response>{'time': 1472146516237, 'text': "Waylon, I'm discouraged to hear you drove away with a dissatisfying experience at our dealership.
